course.subject: IEDA
course.name: Integrated Production Systems
course.description: Basic concepts and techniques in design and operational control of integrated production systems, including MRP, JIT, forecasting, production planning, inventory control, and shop floor control and scheduling.
course.prerequisites: [IEDA 2510 (prior to 2018-19) OR (IEDA 2520 AND IEDA 2540)] AND IEDA 3010

reviews.author: yuma
reviews.comment_content:
Course Outline by Major Topics
1.  Forecasting (1.5 weeks)
2.  Aggregating Planning (2 weeks)
3.  Inventory Control (3.5 weeks)
4.  Push and Pull Production Systems: MRP and JIT (1.5 weeks)
5.  Operations Scheduling (2 weeks)
6.  Project Scheduling (1.5 weeks

Covered quite a lot of algorithms, but most of them are simple and quite interesting.

Very clear and comprehensive steps and examples are given in the notes.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The overall flow in lecture is quite slow and boring,
since the explanation in lecture notes is already very clear and the examples are rather simple, the professor have to speak so slowly and keeps repeating/ reviewing. Hence, lots of student skipped the lessons (especially after the quiz)

Prof. Wu and both TAs are nice, they would stay and answer all questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
You could get a very high score as long as you put everything (steps and examples in the cheat sheet).

Highest score in midterm is 99/100, so be careful not to make mistakes and work faster cause the time limit is quite tight.
The final result is not released.

The grade is very good too.
reviews.comment_workload:
• 10% Homework.
• 40% Mid-term.
• 50% Final.

1 homework for each chapter (about 8 in total). I think it's acceptable, and it's not difficult as well. Just follow the examples in the lecture and tutorial notes and you should be able to finish.

two random in-class quizzes (around 10 minutes each), i missed one but didn't affect the grade much

No project, no present, just midterm and final.
